content.prompt: A metal sphere is hung vertically from the bottom of a spring, and the top end of the spring is attached to the ceiling inside a car. When the car is stationary, the frequency of oscillation for the sphere-spring system is f0. How does the oscillation frequency change, if at all, when the car starts moving forward along a horizontal road with a constant acceleration? Assume the frequency is measured by an observer at rest with respect to the road in both situations.

choices.label: It remains constant at f0 while the car is accelerating.
It becomes lower than f0 and is constant while the car is accelerating.
It becomes higher than f0 and is constant while the car is accelerating.
It increases steadily from the initial frequency f0 while the car is accelerating.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
